TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 717
TEI.2.document_title: Robert Kuykendall to Stephen F. Austin, 12-27-1823

barker_notes.barker_summary: Commerce. Austin as colonial clearing house.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 717

div1.p: Commerce. Austin as colonial clearing house.

Dr Sir I would take it as a favor if you would purchase of Mr. Carter or Fowler 25Ib of his manufactured tobacco and 25lb of hand [tobacco?] You will please write me a note and leave it here informing me whether I can get it or not

As I have not the means of paying for it they will probably take your paper for the tobacco and I will accompt with you for the same I am in great need of it — and am in hopes you will do me the favor to procure it for me
